com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.cluster

Class DistributedConfigurationHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.cluster.DistributedConfigurationHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConfigurationEventListener

    public class DistributedConfigurationHandler
extends Object
implements IConfigurationEventListener
    Handles all the functionality related to distributing configuration in a cluster environment.

    • Constructor Summary

      DistributedConfigurationHandler(String configFileName, ConfigurationAgent configurationAgent, ConfigurationEventPublisher configurationEventPublisher, INotifySupport notifySupport)
      Controls the replication of configuration between nodes.

           throws IOException
        Starts the DistributedConfigurationHandler.
        Throws:

        IllegalArgumentException - if any required objects are null
        IllegalStateException - if already started

        Parameters:

      • getSerializedConfigurationFragmentCount

        public String getSerializedConfigurationFragmentCount(String message)
        Implementation for the get fragment count operation. The hash code requested is first checked to see if it matches our hash code.
        Parameters:
        message - Specifies the hash code we are interested in.
        Returns:
        The number of fragments for the configuration.

      • getSerializedConfigurationFragment

        public String getSerializedConfigurationFragment(String message)
        Implementation for the get fragment message. Returns the requested configuration fragment. Fragment numbering is zero based, so requesting fragment 0 will return the first fragment.
        Parameters:
        message - Specifies the configuration hash code and fragment number requested.
        Returns:
        The configuration fragment requested as a string.

      • getLocalClusterNodeConfigurationHash

        public int getLocalClusterNodeConfigurationHash()
        Accessor for the hash code of the configuration snapshot.
        Returns:
        the hashcode of the configuration snapshot.

      • isConfigurationObjectRegistryHashCodeMismatched

        public int isConfigurationObjectRegistryHashCodeMismatched(SocketEndpoint source,
                                                           int remoteHashCode)
        First check we are a secondary and the other end is a primary, if this is not the case then 0 is returned. If this is the case then the hash codes of the two ends are compared, if they are the same then 0 is returned, if they are different then the remote hash code is returned.
        Parameters:
        source - Socket endpoint of this node.
        remoteHashCode - Socket endpoint of the remote node.
        Returns:
        true if the configuration hashcode of the passed parameters are different. The check is only performed if the remote hash code is a primary node and the local hashcode is a secondary node and is the local node.

      • setAllowConfigMismatch

        public void setAllowConfigMismatch(boolean allowConfigMismatch)
        Setter for the allowConfigMismatch configuration boolean.
        Parameters:
        allowConfigMismatch - If true and if the configuration is changed on the primary then no automatic replication of configuration is made on the secondary. The configuration needs to be manually copied to the secondary.
